Posts.Content: Apr 14, 2011 08:23AM mamadog53 wrote: I managed to get through my day of tests.  I hurt all over from laying in one place so long and walking all over creation from one facility to another but at least that part's over with.  I was very surprised to get my results back so quickly.  My bone scan was negative for cancer and the CT scan only showed that I have some gallstones that I had no idea I had.  That will be the next thing they'll want to yank out.  So looks like I'm good to go for surgery on Monday.  Will check in next week.
Posts.Title: New to this forum mamadog53 AnewBeginning

Posts.Content: mamadog53 wrote: I've been posting a little on the IDC forum but now that I have my surgery date set I think this may be the right place for me.  I saw the surgeon yesterday and have decided on lumpectomy and radiation.  Date is tentatively set for 4/18.  I will also be having the sentinel node biopsy at the time.  She said the lumpectomy should go well but unfortunately she found a tiny lump in my opposite breast.  Might be something, might be nothing but she will biopsy it during the surgery.  She said the lumpectomy should be easier than my hysterectomy which was a piece of cake.  I had the DaVinci hysterectomy and it was so easy.  It's day surgery so I'm grateful for that.  I hate hospitals and the less time I spend there the better I will be.  I'm still dreading the anesthesia part but since I'm having the surgery at the same hospital where I had my hysterectomy I'm hoping I get the same anesthesiologist.  I was told that I could request him.  So what do I need to know before surgery?  And for after?  I read a lot but it seems that everyone's case is different in some way.  I'm just glad things are finally moving along.  The sooner I start the sooner I finish.  My goal is to finish by the end of June and have a month to recover before heading to Maine for our summer vacation or is that a pipe dream? Lynn Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: New to this forum mamadog53 AnewBeginning

Posts.Content: Apr 11, 2011 07:35AM mamadog53 wrote: Tomorrow is a busy day.  I am supposed to have a CT scan, bone scan, appointment with the radiation oncologist and do my pre-op registration.  Problem is that I can't get all the scheduling in sync.  No one will tell me how long each of these appointments usually takes.  I understand that they can't tell me exactly how long but surely they have an idea.  I've never had a CT or bone scan so of course I'm worried about both.  When I called the hospital this morning I was informed that I have to drink some sort of vile substance before the CT on an empty stomach.  Not a good way to start the day.  I hope it doesn't come right back up.  I think I've been doing pretty good remaining calm and going about my business but yesterday I almost had a panic attack for no reason.  I was reading a book and it just came out of nowhere.  I'm wondering if the stress is just now starting to  get to me. The worst part is I will be alone all day tomorrow for these tests.  My husband doesn't fell like it's necessary to go with me since it's just tests and my sister-in-law is out of town until Friday.
Posts.Title: New to this forum mamadog53 AnewBeginning

Posts.Content: mamadog53 wrote: I'm 3 1/2 years out from rads and have been having some rib pain mainly when I bend over like to tie my shoes or pick up something off the floor. Don't know if it's from rads but was wondering if anyone else had experienced this. It almost feels like something "catches" but when I stand or straighten up it goes away. I also have some right side back pain but I think that may be from painting the bathroom. Next onc appointment isn't until May but I may try and get in sooner if this persists. Any ideas? Thanks in advance. Lynn Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: rib pain post rads mamadog53 Varod

Posts.Content: May 30, 2011 04:19PM mamadog53 wrote: I have my dry run tomorrow and start on Wednesday.  They haven't told me anything about lotions or creams yet.  I only know what I've learned on this site.  Maybe that will be covered at tomorrow's appointment.  I have to drive over an hour for treatment and over an hour back home.  I hope I can keep that up or I will face an hour and a half each way via public transit.  Houston is not know for easy commuting no matter what time of day.   I'm having 33 treatments and finish on July 18th.  I am supposed to leave on a trip to Maine on July 23rd.  Here's hoping it all works out. Lynn
Posts.Title: JUNE 2011 RADS bluewillowskys duckyb1

Posts.Content: May 31, 2011 08:42PM mamadog53 wrote: Hi Cindy.  A friend of ours has rented a house near Bar Harbor.  I've never been to that part of the country and I'm so looking forward to it.  It will be a nice change of pace from the summer heat and humidity of Houston for sure.  I did my dry run today and start rads tomorrow.  I'm supposed to finish up on July 18th.  All they told me today was to use Aquafor when necessary.  Absolutely no deoderant (not even the crystal kind) and no shaving.  I guess I'll have to be a hermit because there's no way I could go out in public in the heat and not stink.  I closed the blinds across the back of the house so I can't see the pool.  Does anyone know how long after treatment that you have to stay out of the pool?  What's the problem with getting in the pool anyway?
Posts.Title: JUNE 2011 RADS bluewillowskys duckyb1

Posts.Content: Jun 30, 2011 05:48AM mamadog53 wrote: rohanna, how far along are you in rads? Last might I started having to clear my throat and cough. This morning I woke up doing it again. I am 21/33. I've been having problems with dizziness also. My RO assures me it is not due to rads. Yeah, right.
Posts.Title: JUNE 2011 RADS bluewillowskys duckyb1

Posts.Content: Jul 8, 2011 06:40AM mamadog53 wrote: I'm getting close to the end - only 7 more days to go. Had my first boost yesterday. I made a major mistake of only eating a bowl of cereal since I was running late. Made the 2 1/2 hour round trip, stopped along the way to run a quick errand then stopped to get gas. I started feeling shaky and weak by the time I got home. I managed to eat a bit of leftover chicken before collapsing in the recliner where I stayed for the rest of the day. This morning I am still exhausted and the drive to rads is not appealing at all. I was so hoping I would be able to get through this by myself. Guess I'm just having a pity party this morning. Thanks for letting me vent.
Posts.Title: JUNE 2011 RADS bluewillowskys duckyb1

Posts.Content: Jul 18, 2011 12:50PM mamadog53 wrote: I'm done!  Finished!  33/33.  My skin held up pretty well during the whole ordeal, just a bit of redness near the supraclavicular and pink on the rest.  I drove myself to and from treatment every day.  I won't miss spending 3 hours a day in my car in Houston traffic.  The only bad part of today was that my husband couldn't be there when I rang the bell today.  His boss called a meeting and he couldn't get away.  I despise his boss more now than ever before.  So now I'm packing for a long awaited vacation in Maine.  I'm waiting to start the Arimidex until I get back.  I just want a week of not thinking about breast cancer and treatment and side effects.  Good luck to everyone.  Hang in there!
Posts.Title: JUNE 2011 RADS bluewillowskys duckyb1

Posts.Content: Jun 1, 2011 02:23PM mamadog53 wrote: One down.  32 to go.  The drive to and from will likely kill me before the cancer has a chance.  LOL
Posts.Title: JUNE 2011 RADS bluewillowskys duckyb1

Posts.Content: Jun 3, 2011 06:25AM mamadog53 wrote: Why do some people get molds made and others don't?  I didn't get any made they just put my arm in a trough sort of thing and my left arm they have to roll up a towel and tape me to it because the darn table is so narrow that my arm kept slipping off.  If there was something to hang on to it would be better.  I have another idea also is that they need something to grab hold to in order to get up from the table.  I hate that the techs have to let me grab onto them.  A bar or something would be ideal.  I'm also having trouble staying awake on my long drive as well.  My appointment is at 1:45 pm until week after next then it moves to 11:30 am.  I'm hoping that will make a difference.  When I'm a passenger I can lay my seat back and be asleep before we get out of town.  I've been like that all my life.
Posts.Title: JUNE 2011 RADS bluewillowskys duckyb1

Posts.Content: Jun 28, 2011 08:05AM mamadog53 wrote: This may be a stupid question but is it possible to have a reaction under the opposite side from the treatment side.  My right side is my treatment side but I have a large red pimple like thing under my left breast.  Don't know how long it may have been there.  I have those ugly skin tags in that area also and I may have felt it while drying off after my shower but it didn't hurt until today.  I saw the RO yesterday and she didn't say anything about it.  I will quiz my techs today and see if they can get a better look at it that I can in my bathroom mirror.  Of course it is right where my bra band goes so it will rub until I get home from rads.  Heck, I may just take the darn bra off in the car for the drive home.  My grandmother is probably rolling over in her grave at the thought of someone being outside their own bedroom without proper undergarments.  LOL
Posts.Title: JUNE 2011 RADS bluewillowskys duckyb1

Posts.Content: Jul 18, 2011 03:50PM mamadog53 wrote: Cindy, we are going to be staying in the Bar Harbor area.  I think Trenton is the name of the closest town.  My husband's best friend has rented a big house there for the last week in July.  I've never been to that part of the country but I'm so looking forward to it.  We live in Houston, TX and have been having one of the hottest, driest summers ever.  Right now the water in our pool is too hot to even get into.  I'm looking forward to cool air for a change.
Posts.Title: JUNE 2011 RADS bluewillowskys duckyb1

Posts.Content: Jun 10, 2011 05:52AM mamadog53 wrote: Is the Aquaphor in the tube the same product as the Aquaphor in the jar?  Also, how many times per day are you supposed to use it?  I also got some Miaderm from my neighbor who had breast cancer last summer.  I think she said it was supposed to be used 4 or 5 times per day.  My rad appointment is midday and since you are not supposed to have anything on you before rads how are you supposed to manage the timing aspect?  I've done 7 out of 33 treatments and no reaction yet but from what I can tell reading this board it's only a matter of time.  My RO downplays this of course and just says use it when you can.  Ha!  Since I got diagnosed I could write a book about the things they don't tell you!
Posts.Title: JUNE 2011 RADS bluewillowskys duckyb1

Posts.Content: Jun 17, 2011 07:23AM mamadog53 wrote: Anyone getting a rash yet?  I will have my 13th treatment today and this morning I noticed a slight rash forming.  It's not itchy yet but I want to take care of it before it gets to that point.  I'm using Miaderm and I guess I haven't been getting it high enough.  I am going to ask my rad tech today just how much of an area is getting zapped so I can be sure to cover it.  I tried the Aquaphor a couple of times but I just can't stand it.  I feel like a greased pig when I have it on.  I don't have a problem with the Miaderm or the aloe though.  I can't believe I'm already a third of the way through this.  Not that I'm counting or anything.  The drive to and from the center is the worst part but I try to make use of being out and about to run errands or shop so when I get home I can take off my bra for the day.  I don't know if I'm tired from the rads or just the driving and trying to keep up with things around the house.  I think I'm losing the battle on the housework though.  I'm going to try and catch up on some of that this weekend.  My dogs are shedding and I haven't vacuumed in a month.  Can't believe I'm admitting that!  I'm really not obsessive about cleaning but no one else around here is so it's left up to me.  I wish I could train the dogs to push the vacuum cleaner but all they want to do it herd the darn thing.  LOL
Posts.Title: JUNE 2011 RADS bluewillowskys duckyb1

Posts.Content: mamadog53 wrote: I'm not sure what section this should go in so I'm just going to throw my question out and maybe someone could guide me.  I have recently completed treatment for breast cancer and have started my 5 year hormonal regimine with Arimidex.  I lost my best friend to breast cancer 1 1/2 years ago.  That friend never would go get her mammograms and at diagnosis she was already Stage 4 triple negative.  I grieve her loss every day.  Now another friend won't go get her mammo.  She doesn't have insurance but I know that shouldn't be an obstacle these days.  Heck, I would even pay for it myself if I could just get her to go.  We live in different cities so I don't see her everyday.  She insists that without funds she wouldn't be able to afford treatment anyway yet she seems to have the money for wine and cigarettes.  How do I convince her to get the stupid mammo?  I've tried gently encouraging her and being more aggressive but she just turns a deaf ear.  Any suggestions?  Thanks. Lynn Lynn Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: helping a friend mamadog53 loveb

Posts.Content: mamadog53 wrote: I had my rads yesterday around noon as usual. Then I went grocery shopping and straight home. I decided to rest for an hour or so and when I woke up I was dizzy and extremely tired. I feel a bit better today but still no energy. Is this the dreaded "fatigue" setting in? I just finished my 18th treatment and have been doing really well so far. Is this the way I can expect to feel for the remainder of treatment? Is dizziness common with rads? Posts.Content: Jun 26, 2011 07:51AM mamadog53 wrote: Sounds like I need to call my MO on Monday. My RO is not doing any bloodwork at all. I thought I was supposed to have an appointment with my MO in June but when I called the office they said there was none scheduled. The girl I talked to said she would call me back or if she didn't I was to call her back the following week. I just plain forgot about it until now.
Posts.Title: Dizziness mamadog53 mrsnjband

Posts.Content: mamadog53 wrote: Had my sentinel node biopsy and lumpectomy done on Monday.  I'm still very sore but I managed to sleep in the bed last night.  The first night I slept in the recliner.  I've taken some Ultram for the pain but really it's mostly soreness when I moved around.   The one thing they don't tell you is that the calves of your legs will be sore and shaky from those stupid inflatable things the put on you.  Also I was under the impression that the SNB would be done under anesthesia.  Wrong!  Someone should start a list of things the doctors don't mention unless you specifically ask.  The good news is that the SNB showed no node involvement.  Yea!  Today I get to remove this awful ace bandage arrangement and figure out what's been poking in my underarm.  Needless to say I'm thrilled to be finished with surgery.  Next up is radiation. Lynn Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Surgery done mamadog53 mamadog53

Posts.Content: mamadog53 wrote: I am almost one month post lumpectomy.  Still waiting on Oncotype test results to determine my course of treatment.  It was supposed to have already been done but that's a whole other issue.  At my one week follow up with the surgeon she drew fluid out of the lumpectomy site and said I was healing nicely and come back in a month.  The ridge under my armpit has gone down but the breast itself is changing.  It feels harder now and lumpier in spots.  It's also a bit discolored and still tender if pressed on.  Are these changes normal in the course of healing? My second question is underarm odor.  I still haven't been given the okay to shave or use deoderant and my armpit smells funky even after I shower.  This can't be normal or is it?  Any advice would be appreciated.  Lynn Lynn Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: post lumpectomy questions mamadog53 Sherryc
